column1: Question|Options|Answer
Q. The ................. serves as a facilitator to all members of the Scrum team and runs the daily Scrum meetings.|a. product owner
column2: b. project manager
column4: d. scrum facilitator|c. Scrum master

column1: Q. Agility can be applied to any software process?|a. Yes
column2: b. No  some only
column3: c. Specific where tasks can need not be adaptive and are stringent
column4: d. Only those where the tasks are adapted and streamlined by project team|d. Only those where the tasks are adapted and streamlined by project team

column1: Q. Which phase of UP (unified Process) coincides with deployment activity of generic process?|a. Inception phase
column2: b. Elaboration phase
column4: d. Production phase|d. Production phase

column1: Q. What statement is correct about Sprint Meeting and Sprint Retrospective?|a. In Sprint Retrospective meeting the software engineers do not usually attends.
column2: b. In Sprint Review the main topic is about the possible improvements and suggestions for the developer team to the next Sprint.
column3: c. The main purpose of the Sprint Meeting is a demo for the product owner and the stakeholders
column4: d. In Spring Retrospective the product owner and the stakeholders can provide feedback for the next round of Sprint|c. The main purpose of the Sprint Meeting is a demo for the product owner and the stakeholders

column1: Q. Which one is the Primary Goal for the Agile developer?|a. Focus on Software Improvement
column2: b. Customer Demands
column4: d. Environment Feasibilty|b. Customer Demands

column1: Q. What is NOT true about the majority of software projects?|a. It is difficult to predict in advance which software requirements will persist and which will change.
column2: b. It is easy to predict how customer priorities will change as the project proceeds.
column3: c. It is difficult to predict how much design is necessary before construction is used to prove the design.
column4: d. Analysis design construction and testing are not as predictable (from a planning point of view) as we might like.|b. It is easy to predict how customer priorities will change as the project proceeds.

column1: Q. What effect does Agile methodology generally have on the 'Cost of Change' throughout the development process?|a. It lowers the cost of making changes.
column2: b. It completely removes any costs associated with making changes.
column3: c. It greatly raises the cost of making changes.
column4: d. It has no impact on the cost of making changes. |a. It lowers the cost of making changes.

column1: Q. Who were the primary contributors to the further development of Scrum methods?|a. Jeff Sutherland and his development team.
column2: b. Schwaber and Beedle.
column4: d. The agile manifesto.|b. Schwaber and Beedle.

column1: Q. What is the primary reason for adopting an incremental development strategy in agile software processes?|a. To maximize the amount of design work before construction begins.
column2: b. To ensure predictability in the analysis  design construction and testing phases.
column3: c. To address the challenge of managing unpredictability through adaptability.
column4: d. To minimize the need for customer feedback during the development process.|c. To address the challenge of managing unpredictability through adaptability.

column1: Q. Which one below is NOT the stage of the DevOps loop?|a. Continuous development.
column2: b. Continuous testing.
column4: d. Continuous coding.|d. Continuous coding.

column1: Q. What aspect of Kanban emphasizes introducing changes based on process data and measuring their effects?|a. Managing workflow to reduce waste
column2: b. Making process policies explicit
column4: d. Limiting the amount of work in progress|c. Focusing on continuous improvement

column1: Q. Which of the following statements is accurate regarding XP?|a. XP emphasizes only planning and coding.
column2: b. Testing is not a part of XP's framework activities.
column3: c. XP's organization revolves around four specified framework activities planning design coding and testing.
column4: d. Coding is not considered in XP's development process.|c. XP's organization revolves around four specified framework activitiess planning design coding and testing.

column1: Q. What is the purpose of continuous development in devops work flow ?|a. Delivering the final product to the user
column2: b. Breaking down software deliverables and developing them in sprints
column3: c. Ignoring the quality assurance process
column4: d.Testing code increments manually|b. Breaking down software deliverables and developing them in sprints

column1: Q. Why the unit tests that are created should be implemented using a framework that enables them to be automated in the XP framework?|a. This encourages implementing a regression testing strategy
column2: b. It will save time and money in developing
column3: c. It will be easy for engineers to code
column4: d. This is good for product manager to check|a. This encourages implementing a regression testing strategy (Chapter 20) whenever code is modified

column1: Q. To accomplish incremental adaptation, an agile team requires __________. An effective catalyst for __________ is an operational prototype or a portion of an operational system.  |a. Detailed planning
column2: b. Extensive testing
column4: d. Complete documentation|c. Customer feedback

column1: Q .How does the product owner order items in the product backlog?|a. According to complexity
column2: b. Based on development team's preferences
column4: d. To meet the most important goals of all stakeholders|d. To meet the most important goals of all stakeholders

column1: Q. Which Agile methodology framework addresses the concept of "Pair Programming."?|a. Scrum
column2: b. Extreme Programming.
column4: d. DevOps|b. Extreme Programming.

column1: Q. What is the average time of daily scrum meeting ? |a. 50 minutes
column2: b. 40 minutes
column4: d. 15 minutes|d. 15 minutes

column1: Q. What is a key philosophy of agile software engineering?|a. Strict adherence to predefined processes
column2: b. Emphasis on large  centralized teams
column3: c. Adaptability and rapid response to change
column4: d. Avoiding customer interaction until software completion|c. Adaptability and rapid response to change

column1: Q. What key questions could be asked and answered by all of the team members during a daily Scrum meeting?|a. What did you do since the last team meeting?
column2: b. What obstacles are you encountering?
column3: c. What do you plan to accomplish by the next team meeting?
column4: d. All of the above|d. All of the above

column1: Q. Who runs the daily Kanban standup meetings?|a. product owner
column2: b. leadership of this meeting rotates daily
column4: d. lead developer|b. leadership of this meeting rotates daily

column1: Q. When in the software development process is it generally the most cost-effective to accommodate changes?|a. During the initial stages of gathering requirements.
column2: b. In the middle of validation testing.
column3: c. After the final product has been delivered.
column4: d. Right before the launch of the software.|a. During the initial stages of gathering requirements.

column1: Q. What is a disadvantage of Scrum related to team size?|a. Only suitable for large teams.
column2: b. Product owner decides the number of team members.
column3: c. May not be suitable for large teams.
column4: d. Expert team members are not required in a team.|c. May not be suitable for large teams.

column1: Q. Which of these is not a principle SCRUM artifact?|a. Code Increment
column2: b. User Story
column4: d. Sprint Backlog|b. User Story

column1: Q. Which of the following is not the framework activities of Extreme Programming (XP):|a. Planning
column2: b. Designing
column4: d. Deployment|d. Deployment
